sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the operation of Fourier Transform Infrared (FTIR) Spectrophotometer for identification and structural characterization of pharmaceutical compounds and materials.
sections.scope: Applicable to infrared spectroscopy activities carried out in the Central Instrumentation.
procedure: Ensure the instrument is placed in a dry, air-conditioned environment to prevent moisture interference.
Verify that the desiccant in the instrument is fresh and the purge gas supply is adequate.
Power ON the FTIR spectrometer and initialize the control software.
Allow the instrument to stabilize and purge for at least 15-30 minutes.
Run a background spectrum without sample to establish baseline conditions.
Verify that the background spectrum shows expected features and no anomalies.
Prepare the sample according to the analysis technique (ATR, KBr pellet, or transmission).
For ATR method, clean the crystal surface with appropriate solvent and dry thoroughly.
Place the sample in contact with the ATR crystal and apply uniform pressure using the clamp.
For KBr pellet method, mix dry sample with KBr powder and press into a transparent pellet.
Load the prepared sample or pellet into the sample holder and position correctly.
Set the scanning parameters including resolution, number of scans, and spectral range.
Acquire the sample spectrum and observe in real-time for quality assessment.
Ensure adequate signal-to-noise ratio and peak resolution in the spectrum.
Save the spectrum with proper identification including sample name and date.
Perform spectral interpretation and compare with reference libraries if needed.
Clean the ATR crystal or remove the KBr pellet and clean the sample holder.
Run a cleaning verification scan to ensure no sample residue remains.
Document all spectral data and observations in the analytical record.
precautions: Keep samples dry as moisture can interfere with IR measurements.
Handle the ATR crystal carefully to avoid scratches or damage.
Do not apply excessive pressure on the ATR crystal to prevent cracking.
Use only IR-transparent materials for sample preparation (e.g., KBr, NaCl).
Avoid touching optical surfaces with bare hands.
Clean the ATR crystal with appropriate solvents compatible with the crystal material.
Ensure samples are free from water for accurate IR analysis.
Use appropriate PPE when handling samples and solvents.
Perform regular purging to maintain dry conditions inside the instrument.
